reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening at the Ca' dei Conti-in the pouring rain- to be "greeted" by a staff that barely acknowledged our arrival. This type of acknowledgment was typical of our three day stay. Whenever we made an inquiry the staff, except for the exceptional jack-of all-trades (bellman, handyman, etc.---he was wonderful--thank you!), we felt as though we were somehow intruding upon their time. We were never asked if we would like any help in touring, dining, or shopping--and given the response we received to any requests we quit asking.
reviews.title: Surly & Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At least one group in our party did not receive the accommodations they requested (though they twice confirmed the room arrangement via email prior to our arrival) as the room had been given to another party. Another in our group had reserved a triple- only to discover that the third bed was merely a cot propped in a small ante-room. This cot became known as "the bowl" amongst our group as the poor person attempting to sleep on it went completely into the bowl in the middle. Twice upon returning to our hotel room after it had been cleaned it smelled as if someone had been smoking in our bathroom. Since we do not smoke, we're assuming that perhaps the staff enjoyed a puff or two while cleaning. As for breakfast- what can one really commend about bread products that are stale and fruits that are overripe.
reviews.title: Cute little hotel in a quiet neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlights of this hotel were:
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!
Most disappointing part of our trip to Venice
reviews.text: 1. a wonderful jack-of-all trades who went above and beyond to insure that we had any glasses, bottle openers, etc. that we needed.

reviews.title: good overall
reviews.text: 2. a nice outdoor sitting space in which to enjoy our time having drinks/snacks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late Sunday afternoon, having been dropped off by our water taxi at what we can only decsribe as a "unconventional" point - we had to scramble up onto the walkway! However, we were literally one corner away from the hotel. Our first sight of the hotel was not unpleasant at all, and when we walked in, the general view of the reception area was quite attractive, seemed clean and ordered; a bit OTT for our tastes, but that's Venice for you!
reviews.title: First impressions often DO count!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception proved a small challenge as the welcome from the staff member was a bit on the chilly side, but perhaps we can say again "but that's Venice for you", as we soon found out that there's a bit of an aloofness about Venetians that transcends class, etc. We were shown to room 310. which was surpisingly un-numbered (located betwen 301 and 302 - you work it out!). The room was smaller than we expected, but our overall impression wasn't unfavourable. Hanging/wardrobe space was restricted to a small cubbyhole that comprised of one shelf, half a dozen hangers and our "hotel safe", which I could easily pick up off the shelf without any struggle (security indeed). The en suite showerroom was surprisingly large, however the shower cubicle was more than a bit snug, a shame given the fact that there was plenty of floor space that could have been used to fit a bigger shower. Clean towels, comp products (some of them found to be empty boxes only) and generally clean and fresh smelling. Bed sheets clean, pillows very low and only two in total - we had to supplement by using cushions to get a decent sleep position. Air con very annoying, controlled centrally and on all the time, I doubt the room was the claimed 17 degrees at any time during our stay, and we had to ask them to switch controls to manual to get rid of the noise.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was certainly more than adequate for us, a decent choice of cereals, juice, tea/coffee, cold meats, rolls, yogurts, fresh fruit- all absolutely fine. Serrvice was unintrusive and absolutely fine. The atmosphere between the guests could have been a bit less frosty! One thing - please try to avoid a room on the 2nd floor because they have the breakfasts in the "salon" i.e. the central hallway which all the rooms lead off , and if you like the odd late rise, this is not ideal when breakfasts are served from 06.30 onwards.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, very central, polite staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed at the lack of a dedicated bar/restaurant area, for a claimed 4 star establishment this left us feeling a bit unhappy. We like to have a nightcap, but we were restricted to room service (only until 11pm ) or the fabled mini-bar, and the size of the room was not particularly conducive to doing more than sleeping and showering in, so not great on that point.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location-wise this hotel is great; a genuine 5 minutes from St Marks Square (once you stop getting lost!), and about 10 from Rialto. The free tourist map helps, but we recommend buying another, more detailed one from lots of outlets (about 3 Euros).
reviews.title: There are better places to stay

reviews.text: If travelling via alilaguna, then the directions given on the hotel's website are excellent - we arrived around 11pm and despite getting off at San Marco, we were able to reach our hotel within 30 mins (from San Zaccaria, it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes).
reviews.title: Excellent location....beware room scam especally if arriving late!

reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel, we were pleasantly greeted by night security who then informed us promptly that if we didn't like our room then there was nothing that could be done until the next morning!!! I thought he was joking until he gave us the key to room 409 and literally there wasn't enough room to swing a dead cat - if you prefer cosy then even this room might have been classed claustrophobic. As soon as we opened the door, we could fall into the bed! Also we had booked a double twin, but what we got was a double bed! Anyway being too tired to argue, we forfeited one night. Next morning we spoke to the main reception staff about changing our rooms. The staff member was didn't bat an eyelid at our request and didn't even offer an apology. In fact I felt that this was the not the first occassion this had happened and was by no means an error on the booking. I asked the staff member why this had happened, and she apologised and said that they didn't get the booking until the actual day! Anyway, we managed to get a much bigger room as requested and luckily no more dramas.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Location wise, it is prefect especially because of the lack of public toilets! We walked mostly and could walk to the Rialto Market within 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Useful tips that I would recommend are:
reviews.title: Avoid this place....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definately prebook your tickets on the Venice Connected website, especially for the alilaguna, as they can be double the price when you get there. However, be aware that there are only certain ticket collection booths that will issue you the tickets ON the day and not before. In our case, we had to go to the San Marco stop. Allow plenty of time to reach the ticket collection booth.
reviews.title: Terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be careful at this hotel.....I wish I'd read the NOT SO POSITIVE reviews on this hotel before we went because they did to us what they had one to others....On night one....we arrive at the hotel, we're told our room is full and they are moving us down the street to another property. A terrible place--- room door opens right into the breakfast area, room is decorated like a college dorm room, smallest bathroom on earth with funky 'saloon style' doors, ...I could go on an on!!! And for what we were paying...I was SO DISAPPOINTED!!!!
reviews.title: Bait and Switch -- BEWARE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apparently they do this a lot-- a bait and switch .
reviews.title: Great location and Fabulous Room

reviews.text: My husband went to the main desk again on our second day and by a miracle a room was now available and it was wonderful. Beautifully decorated, wonderful breakfast, nice ammenities, spacious bathroom, etc.
reviews.title: Awful experience for 200 euro/night

reviews.text: So, BE WARE -- it looks like about 20% of the guests on this post have this happen to them.
reviews.title: Very beautiful small hotel near everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you are in the hotel, for which you've seen the pictures on the web, it's great. A great location, a great room...when you are banished to their annex...it's terrible.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location
